channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows moment Massachusetts hospital is struck by flash flood
item.description: Norwood Hospital in southeast Massachusetts, was ravaged by floodwater back on June 28 when almost six inches of water fell in the area.

item.title: Pfizer expects results from its coronavirus vaccine trials by October, CEO confirms
item.description: Pfizer Inc has enrolled 23,000 people in phase III of its coronavirus vaccine trial, which began in July, and says it plans to apply for approval immediately if data shows the jab is safe and effective.

item.title: NSA's surveillance program exposed by Edward Snowden was illegal, court rules
item.description: In a ruling handed down on Wednesday, the US Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit said the program that secretly collected millions of Americans' phone records violated federal law.

item.title: Business leaders warn PM economy will nosedive until coronavirus testing is brought in at borders
item.description: Demanding urgent action from Boris Johnson, business leaders have warned that the 14-day quarantine is crippling travel, wrecking trade prospects and jeopardising economic recovery.

item.title: Mother, 27, 'fatally poisoned her five children aged between one and eight with tablets'
item.description: Named locally as Christiane K., the mother remains in hospital after she hurled herself onto the tracks at Dusseldorf, 20 miles from the flat where her three girls and two boys lay dying.

item.title: Yes, be big and beautiful, but I know the cost that comes later
item.description: ALICE DOGRUYOL: I've read that you are a size 18, while at your age I was a slightly slimmer size 16. However, the weight can really creep on as you get older, as happened with me.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: On David Blaine's balloon stunt and Lawnchair Larry
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Magician David Blaine, flew above the Arizona desert attached to helium balloons before floating back down to earth on a parachute near Page.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: The ex-vacuum salesman who sucked up the Sussexes
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Netflix is now worth some $187 billion and - with 193 million subscribers in 190 countries - is one of the most valuable entertainment companies in the world.

item.title: Anonymous lawyer claims Trump groped her breast in 2006
item.description: The woman did not want to be named but she made the claim in an interview with E Jean Caroll, another Trump accuser, that was published in The Atlantic on Thursday.

item.title: Robert Pattinson 'tests POSITIVE for COVID-19 forcing The Batman to halt filming'
item.description: Sources told Vanity Fair that the actor, 34, has contracted the deadly virus just days after production resumed on the big-budget film.

item.title: Passengers rushed to hospital after 17 injured when world's last ocean-going paddle steamer crashes
item.description: The Waverley paddle steamer crashed near the Brodick ferry terminal in Scotland at around 5.15pm. A coastguard search and rescue helicopter has been sent to the scene.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: It's not just the airlines - UK plc is in a tailspin as well
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: New BBC director-general Tim Davie might have overturned the ban on singing patriotic songs at the Proms. Yet what's the when the country is still cowering in its shell?

item.title: Virgin Atlantic is set to axe ANOTHER 1,000 jobs
item.description: The British airline (pictured, one of its fleet), based in Crawley, West Sussex, will reportedly announce the huge cull as early as tomorrow.

item.title: Countryside Alliance say BBC should drop outspoken wildlife presenter Chris Packham
item.description: BBC boss Tim Davie should sack the Springwatch presenter (pictured) to 'follow through' with his call for impartiality online, Tim Bonner said.

item.title: Pippa Middleton's husband takes charge of Williams F1 team after iconic Formula One family quit
item.description: Pippa Middleton's husband took charge of the Williams Formula One team on Thursday. James Matthews, the multi-millionaire hedge-fund manager, is among three new board members.

item.title: George Washington University professor says she lied about being black
item.description: Jessica Krug, an African history associate professor at George Washington University, revealed on Thursday that she has falsely claimed to be black throughout her career.

item.title: Rebecca Adlington announces she is pregnant with her second child
item.description: Olympic swimmer Rebecca Adlington is expecting her second child.

item.title: You can win a house, but are raffle homes the real deal?
item.description: The odds are unlikely but it's not impossible, as 27-year-old Niomi Boontam will tell you. She now owns a London apartment valued at £500,000 after winning a raffle. Her ticket cost just £5.

item.title: 'Jilted' boy 'made up affair with married teacher to win back his ex-girlfriend's attention'
item.description: Counsel defending Kandice Barber, from Buckinghamshire, alleged the boy had invented a police interview in January last year as a conversation starter with his former partner.

item.title: Beirut blast rescuers 'detect heartbeat' under rubble sparking hopes of finding survivor
item.description: A pulsing signal was detected on Thursday from under the rubble of a building that collapsed during the horrific port explosion on August 4 after a sniffer dog detected something.

item.title: As Putin's rival fights for life after novichok attack, new book asks why West won't confront Russia
item.description: Not content with sentencing his political opponents to death, Josef Stalin inflicted a particularly cruel end on those awaiting execution in Lubyanka, the notorious Moscow jail.

item.title: Tory panic as poll finds Covid crisis has poisoned public's view of the PM
item.description: MPs warned that the situation could not be allowed to continue, with fears aides are obsessed with 'gimmicks' rather than governing and contriving to made a difficult situation even worse.

item.title: Commentator and interviewer Iain Dale highlights the bitter divisions in British society
item.description: Why Can't We All Just Get Along... is Iain Dale's latest book. The book highlights how Theresa May was once told by a Tory MP to 'bring her own noose' and another warned she would be 'dead soon'.

item.title: Why is a new biography reluctant to explore the painter Lucian Freud's priapic excesses?
item.description: The Lives of Lucian Freud: Fame, 1968-2011, is by William Feaver and is the second volume of his biography of the great painter.

item.title: One royal wedding, seven musical stars and a VERY driven mother: Memoir reveals commitment required
item.description: In her memoir, House of Music, Dr Kadiatu Kanneh-Mason - mother to Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason and six other musicians - reveals trials of her disciplined parenting.

item.title: Belarus leader claims Alexei Navalny's poisoning was FAKED
item.description: Lukashenko told visiting Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin in Minsk on Thursday that the call between Berlin and Warsaw showed that the incident was a 'falsification'.

item.title: See nature by the seat of your pants: Simon Barnes offers 23 'spells' to make wildlife visible again
item.description: Nature enthusiast Simon Barnes shares his tips for 'rewilding' yourself. From stepping out in the early hours to hear the dawn chorus to doing a 'bottomless sit' on the ground.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES watches Liz Truss face a barrage of hysteria in the Commons
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Whenever there's a session of International Trade questions, the chamber takes on a whisky sour flavour.

item.title: RAF Typhoons to receive major radar upgrade
item.description: The RAF Typhoons will be fitted with the £317million radar system which is due to be operational by the mid-2020s. The European Common Radar System Mark 2 could save 600 British jobs.

item.title: Four ministries at war: JASON GROVES examines the inside story of the UK's quarantine rules
item.description: JASON GROVES: The controversial quarantine policy has been marred by inconsistencies and Whitehall infighting since it began. The policy may have wrecked thousands of family holidays.

item.title: Harry and Meghan's $150m woke TV has 'no chance to fail' with couple under pressure to make a hit
item.description: Harry and Meghan were today warned their $150m Netflix TV deal has 'no chance to fail' and pressure on them to deliver a hit amid such huge hype could backfire

item.title: Melania Trump lashes out at 'delusional & malicious gossip' after her former friend's book published
item.description: Melania Trump lashed out at 'delusional & malicious gossip' on Thursday after her former best friend revealed the first lady's bitter rivalry with Ivanka Trump and a secret email account.

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover is hit by Covid outbreak as four workers test positive
item.description: The affected workers at the company's Solihull plant are all believed to have worked in the paint shop. Anyone who has had close contact with them has been told to self-isolate at home.

item.title: Meghan Markle sues picture agency over photos of her walking with son Archie in a park
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex has taken a news and picture agency to the High Court over pictures of her and her son Archie in a Canadian park. None of the pictures showed the boy's face

item.title: Cuties director says she was sent death threats over Netflix controversy
item.description: Maïmouna Doucouré, 35, says she faced a barrage of abuse online after Netflix released its controversial marketing materials for Cuties.

item.title: First versions of VW's £36,000 ID.3 electric car land in the UK
item.description: First editions of the ID.3 hatchback have driven off a container ship at Grimsby Port this week, which will be prepped for delivery to customers later this month.

item.title: Brits vent fury as Portugal and Greece stay ON the quarantine-free list despite days of speculation
item.description: Furious Brits have vented their frustrations after Transport Minister Grant Shapps announced Portugal and Greece would not be added to England's quarantine list.

item.title: Daniel Prude: Rochester, New York video of black man who suffocates to death in police custody
item.description: Daniel Prude was left brain dead after the incident and later died on March 30 after he was taken off of life support - seven days after the encounter with police in Rochester, New York.

item.title: Manchester cleaner blew £31,000 after shop staff accidentally transferred £90,000 into her bank
item.description: Comfort Konadu (pictured), 52, from Manchester, admitted theft and was sentenced to 15 months in prison, suspended for two years at the city's crown court.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 1,735 new cases in biggest surge since 4 June
item.description: The last time daily infections were higher was on June 4, when 1,805 were diagnosed with the disease and the majority of tough lockdown restrictions were still in force.

item.title: London ambulance on emergency call is caught in Extinction Rebellion traffic jam
item.description: Footage shows the response vehicle stuck with its lights flashing at a roundabout on Millbank, Westminster, with no way of getting through.

item.title: London 'freezer killer', 36, is found guilty of double murder
item.description: Zahid Younis, 36, has been found guilty of murdering Henriett Szucs, 34, and Mihrican 'Jan' Mustafa, 38, whose bodies were found inside a freezer in his flat in Canning Town, East London.

item.title: Donald Trump seizes on Nancy Pelosi's claim she was 'set up' by salon
item.description: Press secretary Kayleigh McEnany came out swinging at the top , playing on a loop the footage showing Pelosi in the salon as she blasted the Speaker, and Trump tweeted his own take.

item.title: Pride and Prejudice fans enjoy 6ft tall cake version of Colin Firth as Mr Darcy
item.description: The life-sized cake of Mr Darcy has been created to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the BBC mini-series and was unveiled at the National Trust property Lyme Park, in Cheshire.

item.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX completes its SECOND Starship 'hop' with another prototype
item.description: SpaceX completed the second 'hop' of its Starship rocket Thursday at its facility in Boca Chica, Texas - bringing the firm one-step closer to sending humans to Mars.

item.title: Study finds it is nearly impossible not to move along to music
item.description: Researchers in Norway measured the micro-movements of people when music was played and found it was virtually impossible for them to stand completely still. EDM had the biggest effect.

item.title: Seven schools in England send pupils home to self-isolate due to students catching Covid
item.description: Primary and secondary schools in Greater Manchester, Yorkshire, Leicestershire, Lancashire and Buckinghamshire have all been stricken by the virus.

item.title: Girl, three, dies and female passenger, 17, is left fighting for life after Peugeot and van collide
item.description: A three-year-old girl died in a collision after emergency services, including air ambulances, rushed to the scene on the Coast Road in Horden, County Durham at around 2.30pm on Wednesday.

item.title: 'Selfish and irresponsible' organisers of massive house party face police probe after 300 turn up
item.description: Around 300 'selfish and irresponsible' party-goers attended a gathering at Mansion House of Kirkhill in Midlothian on Saturday. A 27-year-old man was fined, but police have launched a new probe.
item.media:credit: The Mansion House of Kirkhill / Airbnb

item.title: Fury over new Tesco charity promotion
item.description: Shopper Jamie Holtom from Cheltenham was outraged after her partner was charged 80p more for a product she bought on the same day in the same store after the bill was rounded up for charity.

item.title: Tim Davie says BBC is 'no place' for 'opinionated columnists'
item.description: The BBC's new Director-General has warned staff who want to be opinionated columnists or woke online campaigners 'You should not be working here' in fiery first speech in charge

item.title: Iran says wrestling champion facing the death penalty 'for taking part in protests' is a murderer
item.description: Iranian champion wrestler Navid Afkari, 27, was sentenced to two death sentences, along with six years and six months in prison and 74 lashes. It was first reported this was for participation in protests.

item.title: Amazon user writes 2-star review about novel set in 2020 because the author didn't mention COVID-19
item.description: Wendy W. Legge left the dissatisfied two-star review for the book Honeysuckle Season by Mary Ellen Taylor. Twitter users are mocking her for expecting authors to predict the future.

item.title: Study finds 60% higher rates of COVID-19 among people with low levels of the 'sunshine vitamin'
item.description: A new University of Chicago, is the first to show higher rates of COVID-19 in people who were recently vitamin-D deficient - within the year - before getting tested for coronavirus.

item.title: Mileage limit set at 75 for test and trace appointments as success rate plunges to worst levels yet
item.description: Test and trace boss Dido Harding has installed a 75-mile limit on travelling to appointments after it was revealed some patients were being asked to drive almost 300 miles

item.title: Now for the PURPLE bin: Confused householders get new container for their paper and cardboard
item.description: More residents in Lincolnshire will now get another bin just for paper and card waste. They already use a bin or bag for plastic, another one for garden waste and another one for home waste

item.title: Britain's super-rich lead the charge in abandoning home nation to live in Italy
item.description: Under the policy, anyone who has not lived in Italy for nine out of the past ten years can apply to pay a €100,000 annual flat tax on all income generated outside the country.

item.title: Blow for PM's back to office push as 74% want to keep working from home
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Research for Mailonline found 74 per cent who had been doing their job at home during lockdown would prefer to continue to do so, at least some of the time.

item.title: Man, 21, jailed for four years for hit and run death of boy, 13
item.description: Liam Wilson, 21, was jailed for four years at Bolton Crown Court today after admitting causing the death by dangerous driving of 13-year-old Jack Worwood on July 7, in Ashton-in-Makerfield.

item.title: Wealthy heiress' collection including 500 pairs of shoes is sold after her death aged 89
item.description: Jenny Simpson, who inherited a large family fortune, was known to splash the cash in big cities but was 'devoted to her home town' of Aldeburgh, Suffolk, where she lived for 30 years.

item.title: Viral TikTok star famous for 'angry reactions' reveals he is homeless
item.description: Oneya Johnson, a 22-year-old who lives in his car in Lafayette, Indiana, earned one million followers in just 24 hours thanks to his brilliant videos.

item.title: Apple invests in world's largest onshore wind turbines in bid to become carbon neutral by 2030
item.description: The 650-foot turbines, located near the Danish town of Esbjerg, are expected to produce 62 gigawatt hours each year - and will be used to power Apple's data center in Viborg

item.title: Council tells furious tenants repainting their houses colour of 'baby poo' will help save the planet
item.description: Hounslow Council claims that by painting the houses the colour reminiscent of a baby's nappy, residents were actually saving more than £300 a year through energy efficiencies.

item.title: Astronomers find first evidence of a 'twisted' planet-forming disc
item.description: Experts from the University of Exeter used a number of instruments including the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope to make the discovery.

item.title: British tourist, 27, faces extradition to Qatar after being found with a cannabis grinder
item.description: Conor Howard, 27, was stopped last October on his way back to the UK from Australia when he was found with the item - which he says he bought for a friend as a joke.

item.title: Number of cot deaths in UK stops falling as 198 are recorded in 2019
item.description: The 2018 figure is also slightly higher than the previous year's figures of 189 deaths, but the number has been declining since records began in 2004 when there were 317 unexplained infant deaths.

item.title: Greek prosecutor tells Harry Maguire to reveal video of Mykonos arrest
item.description: Maguire is appealing his conviction and suspended prison sentence after he was found guilty of assault during a brawl on the island of Myknonos last month.
item.media:credit: speaking to BBC Sport's Dan Roan

item.title: Transvestite son said he put mother 'out of her misery' by stabbing her with sword, court heard
item.description: Philip Tarver, 47, put Angela Tarver's head in the freezer at their family home in Woking, Surrey, because he 'couldn't bear to look at her,' the Old Bailey Heard.

item.title: A supersonic Air Force One? Pentagon asks firm to draw up plans for new Mach 1.8 presidential plane
item.description: The Air Force has awarded a 24-month, $1million contract to Exosonic, a start-up aerospace company that is developing a 70-seat, passenger aircraft that can fly at Mach 1.8 speeds.

item.title: Back to normal by Christmas? Hancock says rapid testing is 'best shot' at ending social distancing
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock said this morning that new technologies that can detect Covid-19 in people's saliva on the spot are Britain's 'best shot' at getting out of its current social distancing rules.

item.title: 'Beautiful and inspiring' mental health student nurse dies just days before her 27th birthday
item.description: Bronwen Morgan, of Cyncoed, Cardiff, died in hospital after being taken from a hotel. South Wales Police are investigating her death but it is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: Diarrhoea, vomiting and stomach cramps 'should be official symptoms of coronavirus in children'
item.description: Researchers at Queen's University Belfast in Northern Ireland found that the detection rate of children with coronavirus rose from 76 per cent to 97 when stomach problems were included.

item.title: Parents of baby who suffocated while sharing bed were repeatedly warned of danger
item.description: A seven-week-old baby died as a result of asphyxia while sleeping with his mother and father, a High Court judge heard. Mr Justice Keehan was told that the boy suffered multiple rib fractures.

item.title: 400 people apply to live in four eco-homes on Isle of Rum twenty miles off Scotland's west coast
item.description: The Isle of Rum, Inner Hebrides, put out a call for tenants to join the population of around just 30 people after building four new two-bedroom eco homes.

item.title: German man drinks SEVEN PINTS of his own pee every day
item.description: Sports coach and student Jan Schünemann, 26, from Hamburg, claims that because of his committed regime, he never gets ill, has more energy and only needs between four and seven hours sleep a night.

item.title: US company 3D-prints luxury homes starting from $100,000
item.description: Mighty Buildings, based in Oakland, California, says it can manufacture a 350 square-foot studio unit in less than 24 hours, giving owners a peaceful hideaway or a luxury home to accommodate guests.

item.title: Ben & Jerry's ice cream, Pez candy and Jelly Bellys: The world's most intriguing food factory tours
item.description: MailOnline Travel has scoured the world, from San Francisco to Yorkshire, to find some of the food brands that allow visitors to catch a glimpse of how their products are made.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN presents a hilarious sneak preview of Meghan and Harry's Netflix deal
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: Meghan and Harry have inspired me to now cast a crystal ball and look into the future to imagine the kind of hyper-woke productions on Netflix from Megxit Productions.

item.title: PLANTS could lead to dead bodies, according to experts who say changes in vegetation are clues
item.description: Plants could lead law enforcement to dead bodies, experts say. Forensic scientists are set to explore how compounds released during decomposition change soil and nearby vegetation.

item.title: Michel Barnier delivers ultimatum on post-Brexit fishing rights
item.description: The EU wants to secure continued access to UK waters for the bloc's fishing boats but Number 10 is adamant that British trawlers will be given priority.

item.title: Daniel Craig risks his life in nail-biting new trailer for No Time To Die
item.description: The actor looked brooding as ever in the trailer which sees him confront villian Safin, portrayed by Rami Malek, who viewers are told is concocting a plan that could kill 'millions'.

item.title: Portugal is on brink of quarantine with Britons facing dash to get flights
item.description: The number of Covid cases in Portugal has been above 20 per 100,000 for the past three days. Pictured is a deserted railway station in Lisbon.

item.title: Paedophile academic who sent fake poison to Theresa May is jailed
item.description: Christopher Doyle, 54, from Cheshire, was today sentenced to two years and 10 months behind bars for posting the white powder to the then prime minister in 2018.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: Stockholm has fewest cases since early March
item.description: Sweden's capital Stockholm saw just 250 of 14,000 people tested last week were infected with coronavirus, a positive rate of 1.8 percent. Officials said the figures were the lowest 'in a very long time'.

item.title: Explorer yacht Ragnar hits the rental market for $525k a week - and it has a helipad and spa
item.description: The yacht, called Ragnar, underwent a 22-month makeover from an offshore supply vessel to a sleek pleasure cruiser. The Dutch-built vessel, which sleeps 12 people, is now available to rent.

item.title: What rapid Covid tests could be used in Britain and how do they work?
item.description: The Department of Health has today revealed it is investing £500million in getting rapid on-the-spot coronavirus tests into public use in Britain's battle against Covid-19.

item.title: Zimbabwe elephants found mysteriously killed doubles to 22 as scientists try to find cause of deaths
item.description: The number of elephant carcasses mysteriously found in Pandamasue Forest, Zimbabwe, has doubled to 22 as more elephants were discovered on Tuesday and Wednesday.

item.title: The end of Amsterdam's red light district? Holland is to consider BANNING paying for sex
item.description: Coalition party Christian Democratic Appeal is calling for paid sex to be banned in the Netherlands. MP Anne Kuik submitted a proposal which is being debated in cabinet today.

item.title: Man who never got to meet his grandfather finally gets to connect with his relative
item.description: Striking pictures captured an elderly outdoor toilet attendant in a French slum, and posters in Switzerland opposing women's voting rights.

item.title: Pest control technician discovers an infestation of cockroaches in Council House Britain
item.description: In tonight's episode of Channel 4's Council House Britain, pest control technician Andy discovers a 'heavy' infestation of cockroaches in a vacant flat.

item.title: Drunken Brits pack onto party boat in Zante - as tourist with Covid admits 'I feel so stupid'
item.description: No one is wearing a mask, while bare-chested revellers wave sweat-soaked shirts over their heads as they bellow out football songs while sailing for several hours in the Mediterranean Sea.

item.title: Wear a mask while having sex but don't kiss, Canada's top doctor says
item.description: Dr Theresa Tam, Chief Public Health Officer of Canada, also suggests monitoring yourself and your partner for symptoms and being aware if your partner is at high risk of contracting COVID-19.

item.title: Fake £20 'Twenty POOND' notes in circulation in Cornwall
item.description: Several counterfeit notes have been seized after they were exchanged in Bodmin, Cornwall. Officers are warning that several others may still be in circulation.

item.title: Herd immunity may be closer than thought because antibody surveys 'dramatically underestimate' cases
item.description: According to antibody testing studies, just seven per cent of people in Britain and 17 per cent of London have already been infected and recovered, but scientists say it could be higher.

item.title: New cycle-friendly road blocks stop paramedics reaching patient
item.description: Emergency services were called to Ealing in West London after the man was found unconscious by residents, but medics were impeded by a new one-way system that stopped traffic entering the road.

item.title: 'A woke joke isn't going to be very funny': Monty Python star John Cleese attacks woke culture
item.description: The former Monty Python star, 80, said Britain should not organise its society around 'the sensibilities of the most easily upset people', because that would lead to a 'very neurotic society'.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook will ban all new politics ads week before election
item.description: Facebook will ban all new political advertisements the week before the election, founder Mark Zuckerberg announced as part of a series of moves to prevent interference in the November contest.

item.title: One of world's biggest brothels files for bankruptcy due to Covid-19 restrictions on prostitution
item.description: The world's largest brothel, Pascha,has been forced to file for bankruptcy as Covid-19 restrictions stop its business. The building, based in Germany, offers services by around 120 prostitutes.

item.title: Female bodybuilder slams men who 'sneer' at her muscles and say they're a turn off
item.description: Wendy Fortino, 37, from Oceanside, California, has always been in great shape; when she was just 10 years old, boys would challenge her to arm wrestles - which she always won.

item.title: Amusing snaps show fearless pets stealing food from their owners
item.description: From eating our cake to thieving our pizzas and slurping on our drinks, these pets, pictured on Bored Panda from across the world, don't seem to mind being caught.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Manchester police make 263 quarantine visits
item.description: Since July 22, Greater Manchester Police said they have received 263 requests from Border Force, and issued fixed penalty notices over breaching of self-isolation regulations in two cases.

item.title: BBC journalist 'uses anonymous Twitter account to troll Jewish Radio 5 Live presenter Emma Barnett'
item.description: Nimesh Thaker is accused of using a Twitter account to support attacks against BBC Radio 5 Live presenter Emma Barnett following rapper Wiley's anti-Semitic outburst in July.

item.title: How coronavirus hijacks the body and 'opens the floodgates' for mass infection
item.description: Scientists in Tennessee analysed the genetics of the virus and found it appears to be able to force the body to make more of the receptors the virus uses to enter the body, allowing worse infection.

item.title: Humans have only been able to digest milk as adults for a few thousand years
item.description: Experts from the Johannes Gutenberg University, studied the remains of Bronze Age warriors that were slain in 1200 BC on a river bank in what is now Germany.

item.title: D-Day veteran, 91, Jim Radford appears in court accused of sex offences
item.description: TV viewers were moved when Jim Radford, of south London, performed his ballad The Shores of Normandy, which reached the top of the charts last year.

item.title: Say cheese! Buddy the dog loves to smile at his owners when they give him a thumbs up
item.description: Kelly Ellise Lockett took a video of Buddy as she sat with family in the garden of their home in Liverpool.

item.title: Duncan Bannatyne's wife Nigora Whitehorn slams 'filthy and disgusting' three star hotel in Italy
item.description: Duncan Bannatyne's glamorous wife Nigora Whitehorn refused to stay at a luxury three star hotel in Italy after branding the accommodation 'filthy and disgusting.'

item.title: Western fury grows over Alexei Navalny Novichok poisoning
item.description: Britain said the Kremlin 'has a clear case to answer' while NATO demanded a 'full and transparent' investigation after a German military lab found that Navalny was poisoned with Novichok.

item.title: Moment WWI replica biplane plummets nose-first towards the ground after it spun out of control
item.description: Photos show Matthew Boddington's replica of the Royal Aircraft Factory BE2c spinning out of control before crashing in Sywell aerodrome in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: MPs accuse French of encouraging migrants to go to UK
item.description: MPs today accused their French counterparts of effectively encouraging migrants to make the perilous journey by small boat across the English Channel.

item.title: Mother, 48, pulls all three children out of secondary school over mask row
item.description: Suzanne Byrne said her son Angelo, 15, told her the news in a phone call an hour into the first day back at Woodchurch High School in the Wirral.

item.title: Genome editing is NOT yet ready to be tried safely in humans
item.description: Landmark report from international experts says not enough is known about the safety or precision of the process for it to be trialled in humans.

item.title: Jane Moore says Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's 'don't deserve' $150m deal with Netflix
item.description: Journalist Jane Moore, 58, said on today's Loose Women that The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, who are now based in LA, were given the deal because of 'who they are', and not 'what they can do'.

item.title: Mother of missing RAF gunner Corrie McKeague fears bones found in Suffolk river could be her son's
item.description: Nicola Urquhart says Suffolk police have been unable to reassure her that bones found in bin bags in the River Stour are not her son's. Airman Corrie McKeague vanished in September 2016.

item.title: Protesters burn French flag in Pakistan as Charlie Hebdo reprints cartoons mocking Prophet Mohammed
item.description: Protesters burned the French flag in Muzaffarabad, the capital of Pakistan-administered Kashmi, amid backlash over Charlie Hebdo republishing controversial cartoons of Mohammed.

item.title: Cabinet Office Minister Chloe Smith's husband is a Covid conspiracy theorist
item.description: Ex-Parachute Regiment officer Sandy McFadzean, husband of the Norwich North MP, attended Saturday's march with thousands of other anti-vaxxers protesting against lockdown measures.

item.title: Plain-clothed Met Police officer points Taser at arrested 'drug dealer' as suspect sits handcuffed
item.description: In a video taken by a witness, three plain-clothed police officers were seen arresting a man believed to be in Custom House in the London borough of Newham.

item.title: Tributes paid to 'inspirational teacher and role model' who died paddleboarding off Cornwall beach
item.description: Simon Flynn, 42, a teacher from Cheltenham, is believed to have been on holiday when he got into trouble in water between Padstow and Rock in Cornwall on Bank Holiday Monday.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg plays Rule Britannia in House of Commons
item.description: The Commons Leader held his mobile phone close to the microphone near the despatch box and pressed play, ensuring MPs heard the words: 'When Britain first, at heaven's command.'

item.title: Boat floats upside down on levitating liquid like scene from Pirates of the Caribbean
item.description: Scientists in Paris have demonstrated tiny boats that float upside down underneath a levitating layer of liquid in an amazing quirk of physics.

item.title: M25 killer Kenneth Noye seen 'without a care in the world' 22 years after he was arrested in Spain
item.description: Road rage killer Kenneth Noye has been spotted laughing while walking down the street in south east England on the 22nd anniversary of his arrest in Spain. The 73-year-old was released last year

item.title: Lockdown decisions should be made on hospital patients NOT 'volatile' new cases, senior Tory says
item.description: Graham Brady, MP for Altrincham and Sale West in Trafford, said using data on new cases was a 'volatile' measure because it is heavily influenced by how much testing is being done in that area.

item.title: Black WWI hero who was born in Trinidad and served in British Army
item.description: Rifleman George Roberts was born in Trinidad in 1890. However, in 1914, he enlisted for Army service in Britain, which he saw as his 'mother country', and joined the Middlesex Regiment.

item.title: Boy, four, learned how to catch waves completely unaided at the age of two
item.description: Four-year-old Joao Vitor, from Guaruja, Brazil, shocked his parents when he rode his second wave unaided at the age of two. His skills have since gone viral and he even rides waves with his older sister.

item.title: Studio apartment with a bed suspended over the stairs went up for sale for £125,000
item.description: A shocked Twitter user shared a picture of the odd bed frame in a studio apartment in Worthing, West Sussex. The property was later taken down from the website OnTheMarket.

item.title: Student, 20, returns to flat six months later to discover PIGEONS have invaded it
item.description: Oluwageorge Johnson, 20, a student at Nottingham Trent University, received an email from accommodation workers to say they found the mess left by the pigeons.

item.title: Keir Starmer ally urges Scottish Labour leader Richard Leonard to 'consider his position'
item.description: Shadow minister Rachel Reeves said opinion polls north of the border were 'pretty dire' for Labour, with crucial Holyrood elections looming next May.

item.title: Great-grandmother reveals her sudden overwhelming urge to breastfeed was a sign that she had CANCER
item.description: Barbara Harvey, 85, from Plymouth, Devon, spent a year forced to secretly 'tweak' her 'tingly' left nipple while out in public to relieve the tingling and itchy sensation she was suffering from.

item.title: Gary Lineker reveals why he is inviting a refugee to come and live in his £4million London home
item.description: The BBC Match of the Day presenter appeared in the video for the International Rescue Committee humanitarian aid group with the voice of comedian Jo Brand and refugee Yasmin Kadi.

item.title: Hair salon 'happy' stylist advert is banned by job centre as it "discriminates" unhappy people'
item.description: Hairdresser Alison Birch was told by a job centre it couldn't run an advert recruiting a 'happy' stylist at AJ's Unisex Hair Salon in Stroud, Glos. because the word is 'discriminatory' - against unhappy people.

item.title: Costa says 1,650 jobs at risk in cost-cutting drive amid fears for post-lockdown recovery
item.description: BREAKING: Cafe chain Costa has said 1,650 staff are at risk of redundancy as it looks to cut costs amid continued uncertainty over when trade will fully recover following the pandemic

item.title: Why Harry and Meghan won't be asking Uncle Edward for tips! A look at Earl's turbulent TV career
item.description: The Earl of Wessex's TV company Ardent Productions, which produced dramas and documentaries, was once labelled 'a sad joke' by fellow entertainment industry bigwigs.

item.title: Britain clears 700 MHz radio waves ahead of 5G auction in January
item.description: It has taken four years and £350 million to get to a point where the government can auction off the spectrum, as almost 20 million television sets had to be retuned first.

item.title: Mother shares her toddler's naughty behaviour online
item.description: Steffi Rox, 37, from Devon., who documents her toddler's naughty antics online admitted she simply 'takes photo and get's on with her day' when he misbehaves - but This Morning viewers disagree.

item.title: NASA astronauts are trying to find an air leak on the ISS
item.description: Most of the station's modules have been ruled out, according to one NASA official, and the source is due to be revealed within days.

item.title: Matt Hancock grilled over envoy role for 'homophobe' Tony Abbott
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock struggled as he was challenged over Mr Abbott's expected appointed to a post-Brexit role.

item.title: Mother goes for a walk on Boeing 737's WING to 'get some air' while waiting to disembark in Ukraine
item.description: A mother-of-two opened an emergency exit on the Boeing 737-86N and climbed onto the wing 'to get some air' after landing in Kyiv on a Ukraine International Airlines flight from Antalya.

item.title: Total size of giant prehistoric mega-shark revealed
item.description: The megalodon lived from about 23 million to three million years ago. The biggest megalodons would likely have had a head round 15 feet long, a 5 foot 4 inch dorsal fin and a 12.6ft tall tail.

item.title: Star Trek: Discovery to debut show's first ever transgender and non-binary characters in series 3
item.description: Producers have confirmed that the new roles will make a debut on the third season next month.

item.title: Couples 'should be allowed to marry in gardens, their own homes or over Zoom'
item.description: The Law Commission, an official body that scrutinises UK legislation, said the rules around weddings in England and Wales are antiquated and 'no longer meet the needs of many couples'.

item.title: Amazon announces it will create 7,000 jobs at its warehouses and other sites across the UK
item.description: The US-based online giant has already taken on 3,000 new employees this year, so by the end of 2020 it will have recruited 10,000 extra staff in the UK.

item.title: Paedophile police officer, 54, who starred in TV documentary Cops UK admits child sex offences
item.description: PC Lee Tatton, 54, appeared on UKTV's fly-on-the-wall documentary Cops UK: Bodycam Squad as a response officer covering Hanley in 2016.

item.title: India suffers world-record spike in coronavirus cases with 83,883 new infections
item.description: A million new infections in the space of two weeks have brought India's total to more than 3.8million but many states are easing lockdown restrictions to ease the economic pain despite the contagion.

item.title: Kent Airbnb hosts banned anyone who weighs more than 16st from staying at their cottage
item.description: Hosts Zsu and Marcus were slammed for a weight restriction on visitors to their cottage Bobbit's Lair in Sandwich, Kent, which they later updated claiming it was due to 'very old oak beams'.

item.title: Estate agents reveal the features that could add as much as 10% to the value of your home
item.description: According to top UK estate agents, there are a number of features that buyers in the current market are looking for - and they can add up to 10 per cent to the value of your home.

item.title: Are these the hardest brainteasers EVER?
item.description: Equity Release Supermarket has created a number of mind-boggling themed brainteasers to encourage Brits to continue embracing the health benefits of outdoor activities post-lockdown.

item.title: Tourists slam 'boring' UK attractions in hilarious TripAdvisor reviews
item.description: Bored Panda has collated a series of amusing UK TripAdvisor reviews - with tourists from across the globe calling Stonehenge 'just a pile of stones' and Warwick Castle a 'wannabe Disneyland.
